data.title: Fix harvesters harvesting resources from underground.
data.body: Fixes #12934.

data.title: Force Mobile units to return to the ground layer when becoming idle.
data.body: Fixes #12914.  Testcase: stop a subterranian/jumpjet unit while they are moving in their respective layers.

data.title: Mouse button implementation?
data.body:
Hi there I thought it'd be faster to get the developers' attention by posting here rather than on the OpenRA subreddit.  Feel free to close this after one of you guys can get back to me.


I've been working on making my own RTS personal project using the Unreal Engine and even though I've successfully found a way to implement the LMB and RMB game functionality...  I thought it'd be a lot better to see how people who are much better than me imeplement those game mechanics.

I tried looking through your repository but I'm not experienced enough with browsing other peoples' code to be able to identify where that specific logic is located.  Can you maybe give me a function name or something to search for or otherwise link me to where the implementation exists in the OpenRA game logic?

data.title: Remove LoadUsing where FieldLoader.GetValue works for the dictionaries
D2K - Add Harkonnen Mission 3b
Throw a more detailed error message when creating invalid frozen actors
data.body:
Before it crashed with an exception like this:
```
Exception of type `System.ArgumentException`: Bounds of actor concreteb 38 (invalid) are empty.
Parametername: bounds
```

I think this error message is more helpful, as it immediately tells you that `FrozenUnderFog` is part of the problem, so that you can decide if you either remove that or fix the bounds of the actor.

Thanks, and sorry for my bad english.

data.title: Prepare Chrome Expression Whitespacing for IntegerExpression (& Readability)
data.body:
Replacing `Evaluator` with `IntegerExpression` requires reformatting chrome expressions to have the required whitespace around binary operators. Closing this does not require actually replacing `Evaluator` with `IntegerExpression`, just reformatting the MiniYaml.

Examples:
 * `(PARENT_RIGHT - WIDTH)/2` => `(PARENT_RIGHT - WIDTH) / 2`
 * `PARENT_RIGHT-35` => `PARENT_RIGHT - 35`
 * `PARENT_BOTTOM-45-50` => `PARENT_BOTTOM - 45 - 50`
 * `PARENT_RIGHT-15-WIDTH` => `PARENT_RIGHT - 15 - WIDTH`

This is simply a matter of finding the expressions and using the spacebar to add the needed spaces.

data.title: D2K - Add Sihaya Ridge to map pool.
data.body:
This is the only 3PLAYX map, so i wanted to get it out of the way while i have some time.

http://resource.openra.net/maps/20633/

data.title: Add stance support for Carryalls
data.body: I mentioned about that on #12575. Our carryalls currently can carry any unit owned by owner of carryall and its allied. One may want to make them only carry owner or enemy units too, i need the latter for my D2K mod. Emparor: Battle For Dune also had such carryall that can carry enemy units.

data.title: Show 'Failed to save map' error message in dialog box
data.body:
Save map error (e.g. map opened in another program) was ignored so user lost all changes without warning.
Now there is error message and user can fix the issue and save again. Optional changes in ConfirmationDialogs support wider texts (e.g. file paths).

Closes #13036.

data.title: Require cancelled move orders to exit tunnels before completion.
data.body: This is my take on the rejecting orders in tunnels issue discussed in #12924.  This extends the "unit must finish moving into the next cell before it can start on the next activity" logic from normal movement cancellation to also apply to tunnels.

data.title: Check for dead destination airfield in ReturnToBase
data.body: Fixes #13147.

data.title: OpenRA crash window popup disappeared on Windows.
Separate spectators lag from players ?
data.body:
The idea : let the players continue fluidly and ignore the spectator lag.

If the specs missed some moments of the game, their view could just skip to the current moment (similarly to watching a live video on YT, Twitch, FB, ... with a bad connection )

Or they could just be kicked out if their ping is bad, without holding or freezing the game. 

Is it possible, the way the game is coded ?

Cf title

data.title: Added WithTurretedAttackAnimation
data.body:
Fixed branch of #13065.

Carried over +2 (including my own).

data.title: Unknown settings should be stored and resaved
data.body: Our settings parser ignores any yaml entries that do not map to defined options, and so these are lost when the settings are reserialized.  This is a major problem for forward and backward compatibility now that we are aiming to support parallel installs.

data.title: Move web urls from user config to mod config.
data.body:
This PR moves the master server, game news, and map repository URLs from settings.yaml into a new `WebServices` block in mod.yaml.  The defaults are set so that yaml does not need to be explicitly defined.

This makes it possible for third party mods to run their own services, and improves our forward compatibility if we ever need to change these ourselves in the future.

Unfortunately we can't include the global chat here without giving that a major rewrite.

data.title: HackAI SupportPowers don't have a Z axis check
data.body:
It's been puzzling me for the longest time wondering why the yaml code that runs perfectly fine in RA1 and TD kills over in TS and I'm thinking it might have to do with the fact the AI doesn't have a check for height when scanning for possible targets.  I thought it was rather strange because this shouldn't affect a flat map but for some reason it does.  I'm unsure why this is since you'd think a flat map wouldn't have any issues since it doesn't have a Z axis but something is going on that is causing yaml targeting code for support powers to not work the same way.

I'm still hunting for other possible causes but this seems the most likely at the moment.

data.title: TD Flame infantry spread.
data.body:
Increases the flame infantry attack spread from 341 to 468.

This allows the flame infantry to have a wider cone attack as the previous 10 damage increase helped. They still however lacked the wide attack spread needed on massive infantry assaults. Their attack spread matches that of grenadiers and a lot of armaments (Artillery) and being a frontal unit can use a slight increase to help with this.

Units going prone still takes three hits to kill infantry (two for e3 and anyone standing).

This completes the set (with #13133, #13129) of packaging changes for #12554.

~~Once again, depends on #13049.~~

Test build (fake playtest): [openra_playtest.20170416_all.deb](https://www.dropbox.com/s/bj24fn27ctruiqx/openra_playtest.20170416_all.deb?dl=0)

data.title: Scatter command for aircraft.
data.body:
This is a bit of an odd one. I see it mainly usable on Yaks and MIGs.

Scattering the Yaks/MIGs would allow them to seperate from their group or attacking target and come in from various directions enabling better boxing control. Most useful if you have about 12+ and keep them from running in at a straight line.

data.title: Guard command.
data.body:
The guard command (Hitting G and selecting it on a unit) Works rather well but is it possible to add a limit on this?

IE: Unit on guard follows MCV and then engages the enemy. MCV then runs away but the units don't follow the MCV and instead stay back to fight.

This would make vehicles that are on guard (Mainly the turreted ones) more dangerous. Infantry would pose some issues possibly in which case manual use can be done. The Guard command also works on aircraft.

It also has the issue of when a unit kills a unit/structure the unit is no longer on Guard follow and instead jus stands in the place it was attacking at last.

data.title: mono 5.0.0 engineer capture bug
data.body:
if openra run with mono framework 5.0 on a mac, engineers can't capture buildings. infantry also can't target enemy. helicopters , tanya , a few tanks and ships work ok.

looks like something broken with mono 5 or mono 5 has some bugs in it.

don't get mad with the openra code if this happens to you. (it took me a while to realise this)

data.title: VariableExpression: whitespace/hyphen/binop parsing fix
data.body:
Fixed line 325 of OpenRA.Game/Support/ConditionExpression.cs as mentioned in #13130. I had decided that it would be easier to use spaces to disambiguate minus and negative since condition names could have hyphens, and then forgot to mention that. Binary arithmetic and logic operators require whitespace around them and CharClass.Mixed characters, including `-`, are restricted to the middle of variable names.

Closes #13130.

data.title: Update Windows packaging for per-mod launchers.
data.body:
This updates the windows packaging to install separate launchers and shortcuts for each mod, as well as some other much needed changes:

* Release/playtest/dev installs are treated separately and can now be installed side by side.
* Removed the readme and uninstaller links from the start menu to conform with [best practices](http://nsis.sourceforge.net/Best_practices#Start_Menu.2FStart_Screen).
* Includes additional metadata (version, install size, readme, quiet uninstall command) for the control panel software list.

~~Depends on #13049.~~

Test build (fake playtest): [OpenRA-playtest-20170415.exe](https://www.dropbox.com/s/e2jqjkgubymblgl/OpenRA-playtest-20170415.exe?dl=0).
Test build (dev version): See Appveyor artefact page.
The two test builds can be installed together to test the side-by-side version support.
